tool.name: HTS barcode-checker
tool.description: Scan a fasta file for CITES species
tool.command: HTS-barcode-checker.py --input_file $input --output_file $output #if $BLAST.blast_loc == "local" -lb #end if #if $local_cites.CITES_loc == "local" --CITES_db $local_cites.CITES_db #if $local_cites.update.cites_update == "force" --force_update #elif $local_cites.update.cites_update == "avoid" --avoid_update #else #pass #end if #else -new $output.id $__new_file_path__ #end if #for $add_cites_db in $add_cites_dbs --CITES_db "${add_cites_db.add_cites_db}" #end for --log_file $log_file --BLAST_algorithm $blast_database.blast_al --BLAST_database $blast_database.blast_db --hitlist_size $hitlist --min_identity $min_iden --min_coverage $min_cov --max_evalue $max_e #for $blacklist in $blacklists --blacklist "${blacklist.blacklist}" #end for --logging $logging

param.name: blast_db
param.label: Blast protein database
param.option: Last release of the swissprot protein database
Sequences derived from the 3d structure records of the protein data bank
Non-redundant CDS sequence from environmental entries

param.name: CITES_loc
param.label: CITES database
param.option: No local CITES database, will download a new copy

param.name: hitlist
param.label: Maximum number of blast hits per sequence

tool.help:
HTS-barcode-checker
The HTS-barcode-checker takes a fasta file and BLASTs the sequence against a reference database. The tool checks the blast results for CITES protected species and reports these to the user.
.. class:: warningmark
The tool will BLAST each sequence against through the NCBI servers, try to limit the number of fasta sequences by clustering or filtering (Ideally sets should contain no more then a 1000 sequences).
Additional files are CITES databases (if non provided the tools will download a new copy, however this can take some time) and blacklist files (genbank IDs that are incorrectly annotated), both these files can be uploaded with the default galaxy "get data" function (datatype can be set to "txt").
